meanings.definition: A device on an aircraft used for catching arresting cables on a carrier deck.
meanings.sent1: The tailhooks on the plane caught the cables smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The pilot skillfully engaged the tailhooks to land safely on the carrier.
meanings.sent3: The tailhooks decided to take a break and refused to catch the cables, causing a funny delay.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the tailhooks, never letting go until she achieved her goal.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tailhooks gleamed in the sunlight, ready to do their job.

meanings.definition: The act of catching an arresting cable with a tailhook.
meanings.sent1: The successful tailhooks made the landing on the carrier look easy.
meanings.sent2: The tailhooks' engagement with the cable was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The tailhooks celebrated their perfect catch with a little dance.
meanings.sent4: His focus was like the precision of the tailhooks, never missing its target.
meanings.sent5: The tailhooks' swift action saved the day, preventing a disaster.

meanings.definition: To equip an aircraft with a tailhook.
meanings.sent1: The mechanics will tailhooks the aircraft before the next mission.
meanings.sent2: They decided to tailhooks the plane for carrier landings.
meanings.sent3: He will tailhooks the jet with the new device for better safety.
meanings.sent4: She carefully tailhooks the aircraft, ensuring a secure landing every time.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to tailhooks the fighter jet efficiently.
